method: Preheat the grill to medium heat.
In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Shape the pork mixture into burger patties of your desired size.
Grill the burger patties for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and slightly charred.
During the last few minutes of grilling, brush the burgers with barbecue sauce.
Remove the burgers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill for a minute or so until lightly toasted.
Assemble the burgers by placing a spoonful of coleslaw on the bottom half of each bun.
Top with a grilled pork burger and cover with the top half of the bun.
Serve the pork-a-doodle burgers immediately and enjoy the cluck-tastic flavors!
